3. overkill on ssd, atleast just a 990 pro 2tb is what i would do, some swears on even cheaper ssd's like crucicals p3 or p5 line

4. that gpu is a bad choice, consider a 9070 xt or a 5070 ti or maybe a 7900xtx on sale or used or something, at any rate dont select a gpu with less than 16gb vram

Valhalla is my favorite by far, yes, there is a ton of content, but i play during RPG sessions where i really enjoy being able to just go and pick up a random ingot without having to focus on the game.

Origins got kinda shit rpg mechanics and gameplay, and i dont love the character, but it got probably the best of the worlds and a great story

Odyssey is a mix between origins and valhalla in most regards, it felt for me the most 'open' with its war mechanics and quite a bit more polished than origins, and kassandra is a great character (sorry alexios)

Mirage would have been a great dlc, as a full priced stand alone game it felt like a big step down, but much more 'assassin' based than the other 3

There is a risk of damage, yes. 

its not \*incredibly\* high, but if you do it multiple times per day...

i would personally do a 9800x3d then, but it really depends, when its on a hobbylevel for fun, i would 100% save the money and prioritise gaming performance.

but if you plan on doing it for money or many hours per week i would flip the priority

gaming 9070 xt

productivity depend on the specific job i think, most cases 9070 xt but some jobs favor nvidia heavily

it depends on your local market.

you have a good cpu, so with that i would look into Intel B580's on the cheap end, Used AMD 6800/6800 XT on the medium end, or a 9070 or 9070 XT on the high end

alternatively you may find a 7900 GRE or 7900 XT or 7900 XTX at a cheaper price as a new generation have launched 

if you value longevity on your card i would not buy anything with less than 16gb VRAM on anything but the very low end, and even then 12 is the minimum to even consider.

the 4060 just have no longevity with 8gb vram, the 4060 TI is overpriced AF, and the 5070 is a insult and if you look up 'planned obsolensence' in the dictionary you will find a picture of it.

  
For your specific needs with those games you could look into prices of a 7700 xt as admitedly vram is not the most important for those games, you wont need any of the nvidia 'special' features for any of the games you describe.

  
but at the end of the day it depends on price and availability and the market is dumb right now

yes and no; its good at producitivty, yes, its a modern high end cpu

however, there are better cpus for productivity, what is your job and what balance do you seek? if gaming is what you care most about then its fine, if you care more for productivity consider a 9900x or a 9900x3d instead etc. It will give you more producivity oomph at a gaming performance penalty, but either of those cpu's are still more than powerful enough for any gaming needs

they are slightly different and excell at different things.

XTX got higher vram capacity so in the future will age slightly better, it got superior software (Adrenaline vs control panel) and there are some games where it beats the 4080 and even approaches the 4090 in raster.

the 4080 are stronger in ray tracing, got superior features such as a better upscaler and AI and content creation things (Through, the xtx are perfectly fine at a hobby level) 

imho the physical design of the 4080 are also superior in terms of thingsl ike temperature, but the xtx are superior in not having the 12 pin connector, are physically smaller and got superior connections.

  
At the same price it is generally recommended a 4080 unless you are very focused on one or two games and those games happen to be where the xtx excell.

  
otherwise my personal point where i start to recommend the xtx over the 4080 is when the 4080 is more than 150 dollars more expensive
